result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Sholar Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert A Sholar Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Robert A Sholar Jr.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date be set. Court sets the deadline of 1/19/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Request of Defense counsel to adjourn Plea and Sentencing hearing due to scheduling conflict. With Court approval, and of all parties, the Plea/Sentencing is rescheduled from 10/6/2022 at 11 am to 10/13/2022 at 3 pm

Defendant Robert A Sholar in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion wth attorneys placed on the record. Court sets 10/03/2022 as the deadline for filing change of plea forms and/or sentencing documents.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert A Sholar in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  With the court's permission, this matter was scheduled off the record  Defense has received offer from the state.  Court ordered deadlines for filing:  Discovery to be filed by 5/31/22, with the exception of Crime Lab results; Any motions are to be filed by 6/17/22;  All trial documents (and change of plea forms, if change of plea is requested) are to be filed by 6/28/22.  Next court date in Br 17 is for pre trial confernence.  mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in trial in another court and unable to appear for scheduling.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court ordered this matter adjourned to 4/15 at 11:15 for scheduling in Br 17.  Defense was notified.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Robert A Sholar in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert A Sholar in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Jones is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Robert A Sholar in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Milwaukee County Sheriff on 01/13/22
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/7/22 @ 2:30p
